I ordered this skirt for a date night. I’m a bigger girl. I figured I’d order it in the largest size and make alterations if it’s too big just in case. I got the skirt in and was so excited…. Until I opened it up. They’d sent me a small. I was like okay, no biggie, I’ll return this one and reorder it. So that’s what I did… I got it yesterday and was soooooo excited! But I had to wait til today because I had errands to run yesterday and didn’t get home til late and didn’t wanna try it on last night so I waited until I got home from work today. I just opened it. Tell me why it’s a SMALL again?! I ordered a 4x! Now I have to send THIS one back out too and get a refund cause I’m not trying again just to be disappointed. I have a sewing machine. I’ll make my own freaking clothes. If anyone can get the right size shipped to them, it’s kinda cute. Feels like a soft denim up top. Soft tulle. Doesn’t come with the belt thing but that’s not why I bought it anyways. Seems well made and sturdy. But I won’t order from the company again.

This layered skirt is very well made, and it's comfortable.  It also comes with a tape measure -- for whatever reason.  The seams are straight, and the material is a nice thickness with an A-line cut.  The cute belt on the model in the ad does not come with it.

This is unique and different. You could wear it as a gothic look or for Halloween. This is a cute skirt. I liked it. I thought it was flattering. I thought the fit was pretty good. I thought that it was unique and looked good.  The skirt was relatively comfortable. The fit was okay. It wasn't too hot, which for me is important since we live in Florida.  It wasn't too hard to clean. I thought it seemed trendy. It felt durable and the fabric was relatively soft. It would work in a wide variety of settings.  It was as described and I would recommend it.

Sizing wasn't correct. My daughter is a 12/14, we ordered a 14/16 and it wasn't even close to fitting. So tight she couldn't even get it up completely. The top fabric is thick and has no stretch, recommend sizing up a minimum of 2 sizes. Great quality, felt amazing and was well made but the sizing was off.

I fell in love with this skirt straight out of the bag. It's so well-made and really brings out the emo-girl in me. However, I always wear a medium/large and large is always comfortable or even loose on me. This skirt was tight on me and it barely fits... literally one wrong move and it might tear. I would recommend ordering a size up just to be safe. Other than that, I'm on my way to lose a couple pounds because I wanna wear this so badly!! It's so cute!

The PUNK RAVE DAILY Women High Waist Skirt Plaid A-Line Skirt with Tulle I'm a fan of.  I'm five foot two and a half inches tall, 128lbs, and sport a curvy pear-shaped figure. I typically wear a 6, 28, or small/medium in pants and skirts depending on the brand. I am curvy and don't have the tiniest waist or hips so I went with the size 8 and found the fit perfect. The length is a couple of inches above my knees.  This skirt is easy to put on thanks to the zipper closure. It doesn't have shorts under it but the weight is enough that it's not going to go wafting up so much in the breeze. It looks cute paired with thigh highs, fishnets, and other leggings.  It is thick enough to not be seen through yet light enough not to overheat you when worn. The layers and the cut are excellent and it doesn't look or feel cheap.  I wanted to mention it does not come with the belt pictured but there are loops to wear one of your own.  I wash it on a cool gentle cycle and have let hang to dry. It has not faded, shrunk, or shown any other signs of wear with much wear. There are no off seams or loose strings.  Highly recommended.
